intro: Valeriana erysimoides, commonly known as the yellow valerian, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Valeriana erysimoides is often found in shaded areas and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
